results.definition: bring, lead, or force to abandon a wrong or evil course of life, conduct, and adopt a right one

examples: The lazy student promised to reform

results.definition: a campaign aimed to correct abuses or malpractices
examples: the reforms he proposed were too radical for the politicians

results.definition: a change for the better as a result of correcting abuses
examples: justice was for sale before the reform of the law courts

results.definition: improve by alteration or correction of errors or defects and put into a better condition
examples: reform the health system in this country

results.definition: make changes for improvement in order to remove abuse and injustices
self-improvement in behavior or morals by abandoning some vice
examples: the family rejoiced in the drunkard's reform
